sn22.70:1.2: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha … and asked him,
sn22.70:1.3: “Sir, may the Buddha please teach me Dhamma in brief. When I’ve heard it, I’ll live alone, withdrawn, diligent, keen, and resolute.”
sn22.70:1.4: “Mendicant, give up desire for whatever is shaped by arousal.”
sn22.70:2.1: “But how do you see the detailed meaning of my brief statement?”
sn22.70:2.2: “Sir, form is shaped by arousal; I should give up desire for it.
sn22.70:2.6: Consciousness is shaped by arousal; I should give up desire for it.
sn22.70:2.7: That’s how I understand the detailed meaning of the Buddha’s brief statement.”
sn22.70:3.2: It’s good that you understand the detailed meaning of what I’ve said in brief like this.
sn22.70:3.3: Form is shaped by arousal; you should give up desire for it.
sn22.70:3.7: Consciousness is shaped by arousal; you should give up desire for it.
sn22.70:3.8: This is how to understand the detailed meaning of what I said in brief.” …
sn22.70:3.9: And that mendicant became one of the perfected.
